db:abstract.db:para: The QTextTableFormat class provides formatting information for tables in a QTextDocument.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QTextTableFormat is part of Rich Text Processing APIsshared

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A table is a group of cells ordered into rows and columns. Each table contains at least one row and one column. Each cell contains a block. Tables in rich text documents are formatted using the properties defined in this class.
Tables are horizontally justified within their parent frame according to the table's alignment. This can be read with the alignment() function and set with setAlignment().

Cells within the table are separated by cell spacing. The number of pixels between cells is set with setCellSpacing() and read with cellSpacing(). The contents of each cell is surrounded by cell padding. The number of pixels between each cell edge and its contents is set with setCellPadding() and read with cellPadding().

The table's background color can be read with the background() function, and can be specified with setBackground(). The background color of each cell can be set independently, and will control the color of the cell within the padded area.

The table format also provides a way to constrain the widths of the columns in the table. Columns can be assigned a fixed width, a variable width, or a percentage of the available width (see QTextLength). The columns() function returns the number of columns with constraints, and the columnWidthConstraints() function returns the constraints defined for the table. These quantities can also be set by calling setColumnWidthConstraints() with a vector containing new constraints. If no constraints are required, clearColumnWidthConstraints() can be used to remove them.

db:section.db:title: QTextTableFormat::QTextTableFormat()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new table format object.

db:section.db:title: Qt::Alignment QTextTableFormat::alignment() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the table's alignment.

db:section.db:title: qreal QTextTableFormat::cellPadding() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the table's cell padding. This describes the distance between the border of a cell and its contents.

db:section.db:title: qreal QTextTableFormat::cellSpacing() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the table's cell spacing. This describes the distance between adjacent cells.

db:section.db:title: void QTextTableFormat::clearColumnWidthConstraints()
db:section.db:para: Clears the column width constraints for the table.

db:section.db:title: QVector<QTextLength> QTextTableFormat::columnWidthConstraints() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of constraints used by this table format to control the appearance of columns in a table.

db:section.db:title: int QTextTableFormat::columns() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of columns specified by the table format.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] int QTextTableFormat::headerRowCount() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of rows in the table that define the header.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.

db:section.db:title: bool QTextTableFormat::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this table format is valid; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: void QTextTableFormat::setAlignment(Qt::Alignment alignment)
db:section.db:para: Sets the table's alignment.

db:section.db:title: void QTextTableFormat::setCellPadding(qreal padding)
db:section.db:para: Sets the cell padding for the table. This determines the distance between the border of a cell and its contents.

db:section.db:title: void QTextTableFormat::setCellSpacing(qreal spacing)
db:section.db:para: Sets the cell spacing for the table. This determines the distance between adjacent cells.

db:section.db:title: void QTextTableFormat::setColumnWidthConstraints(const QVector<QTextLength> &constraints)
db:section.db:para: Sets the column width constraints for the table.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.2] void QTextTableFormat::setHeaderRowCount(int count)
db:section.db:para: Declares the first count rows of the table as table header. The table header rows get repeated when a table is broken across a page boundary.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.2.
